explore! next
bottom left: - call list for each email campaign that you send next
bottom right: - name and contact info - recipient scores - higher score = higher interest (flames!) next
remember to check the notes tab for tips and tricks! next can you show me how?
chapter 2 creating the email
select "customize an email" to get started! i can do this!
what else is in the mini (menu) bar? click next! get in gear with advanced options.
next arrow icon swaps image with image to the left. swapping may involve multiple blocks to preserve layout.
pencil icon edits: text, image properties and links now let's look at editing image properties. next
let's see what's in stock templates! my templates will organize and hold nicky's templates stock templates holds professional quality templates to get started!
next templates are organized in "blocks" let's edit these blocks! click next to learn how!
select the cupcake template to continue! lots of awesome templates organized by category! mmm cupcakes! let's use that one!

hovering over a block displays a mini menu bar for editing. visit each icon on the mini-menu bar then click next to continue explore the mini (menu) bar! really? you didn't fully check out the mini-menu bar yet... try again! skip ahead!
next for better reporting, use multiple links! let's see what else in in the mini (menu) bar! click next

next plus sign = move that block! what else is in the mini (menu) bar? click next.
chapter 3 managing groups
let's figure out who we're going to send this to. i've already got lots of contacts in act!
we're in act! now. my groups are ready! next
chapter 4 sending the email
click "send an email" and let's send this! i'm so excited to send this!
grand opening existing - 15mi radius click ok to keep going!
wow! confirmation that it was sent! i thought you'd want to know! next
i know who to call based on their interest! call lists for each campaign. scores and "flames" indicate level of recipient interest. next
chapter 5 tracking results
click on campaign reports
awesome open rate! click it to look closer!
business intelligence! click the eyeball to dive in for more detail!
who's engaged with the campaign! click close to continue.
let's look closer! click the eyeball.
what's hot? click close to continue.

here's how my tables look! i'm ready!! here's how my tables look! i'm ready!! return to course

how many recipients opened the email. which of the following does act! emarketing track: which links in the email were clicked and how many times. how many recipients opted out. all of the above. select your answer then click submit next question return to course all of the above get valuable business intelligence through campaign reports. all of the above get valuable business intelligence through campaign reports.

slidetranscripts.slidetranscript:
Act! emarketing can help you grow your business.

Let’s get to know Act! emarketing.

But before we do that, let's take a quick tour of this interactive learning environment.

This learning experience has 4 onscreen areas you should know about.
Let's learn a bit about each one so you'll be able to navigate through the material.

The interactive player is the main window of the course content.

This interactive window may show videos, images or text.

It may also call for your interaction (by clicking) in order to proceed.
The Notes Tab contains additional text about the current course content. Sometimes, additional "Tips and Tricks" or Business Best Practices may appear here. Be sure and check it it out!

The Menu Bar on the left is like a Table of Contents.

Click the triangles to expand and collapse the amount of details and subheading shown.

Click on the text to navigate to the content directly.

On your first pass through this material, we do recommend that you simply proceed from start to finish to get the full experience, however, you can use this menu bar to "jump around" find topics that interest you or when you're repeating the training or additional clarity.
Player Controls allow you to adjust or mute the volume, pause or replay the current content, and sometimes includes navigational controls such as "Next."

After a brief introduction to Act! emarketing and meeting our protagonist, Nicky, we’ll learn how to create a customized email campaign and determine the recipients by managing our groups in Act! Then we’ll watch as Nicky sends her email and Tracks the Results through the Campaign Manager.

Meet Nicky. She’s going to help us learn about Act! emarketing.

Nicky has owned and operated a successful catering company for years.

Throughout that time she has used Act! to manage her contacts and grow her business. Now as she gets ready to take the exciting step of expanding into a full service café, she wants to know how to use Act! emarketing to promote her grand opening and ensure the ongoing success of her business.

Let’s tag along with Nicky as she learns!

Basic layout for Act! emarketing:

The top panel is the main area where you will take action to Create an email campaign, Manage your Groups, Send an email and view Campaign Reports. We will explore each of these in more detail.

The lower left panel contains your Call Lists. Every time you send an email campaign, Act! emarketing automatically generates a Call List for you to help you manage your next steps.

The lower right panel displays the details of the Call List selected on the left. In addition to contact information, Act! emarketing will display a Score that has been generated based on upon the level of interaction by the recipient with your email campaign. The score is represented by "flame" icons. The higher the score, the more "flames" and the hotter the prospect. This is great information to have to see who is interested in your campaign and help you structure your follow-up activities.

This is the basic layout for Act! emarketing.

The top panel is the main area where you will take action to Customize an email campaign, Manage your Groups, Send an email and view Campaign Reports. We will explore each of these in more detail.

The lower left panel contains your Call Lists. Every time you send an email campaign, Act! emarketing automatically generates a Call List for you to help you manage your next steps.

The lower right panel displays the details of the Call List selected on the left. In addition to contact information, Act! emarketing will display a Score that has been generated based on upon the level of interaction by the recipient with your email campaign. The score is represented by "flame" icons. The higher the score, the more "flames" and the hotter the prospect. This is great information to have to see who is interested in your campaign and help you structure your follow-up activities.

The top panel is the main area where you will take action to Create an email campaign, Manage your Groups, Send an email and view Campaign Reports. We will explore each of these in more detail.

The lower left panel contains your Call Lists. Every time you send an email campaign, Act! emarketing automatically generates a Call List for you to help you manage your next steps.

The lower right panel displays the details of the Call List selected on the left. In addition to contact information, Act! emarketing will display a Score that has been generated based on upon the level of interaction by the recipient with your email campaign. The score is represented by "flame" icons. The higher the score, the more "flames" and the hotter the prospect. This is great information to have to see who is interested in your campaign and help you structure your follow-up activities.
The first step is to create an awesome emarketing campaign.

Like most small business owners, Nicky doesn’t have a big budget for marketing.

So, she was really excited to find out that Act! emarketing comes with dozens of professional quality templates that can be customized to fit any business. They’re also organized by category based on the type of business and Nicky is pretty excited to see there’s a category with lots of samples that will work for her. Let’s pick a yummy looking template and start customizing it for Nicky.

To start your email campaign, select Customize an Email.

The Gear icon offers advanced options to Duplicate or Delete an entire block.

Hover your mouse over the block you want, click the Gear icon from the mini-menu bar, and select your choice.

The Arrow icon swaps the current block with the block to the left.

Hover your mouse over the block you want to swap, click on the Arrow icon.

The PENCIL ICON lets you edit the contents of the block and that means different things based on whether you’re editing a block of text, a block with a picture in it, or hyperlinks. Let’s start by looking at how to edit a block of TEXT.

TEXT:
To edit the text in a block, hover your mouse over the block and click on the Pencil icon to edit it. A text editing box will appear and you can replace the placeholder text with your own text. You can even format the text for color, font, size etc. Remember, you must "Commit Changes" or Save the block in order for your custom text to "stick" - always click the "Commit Changes" or Save icon (floppy disk) in the upper right of the block when you've finished your edits.

IMAGES:
Now let’s look at what the pencil icon does when editing a block with a picture in it. When you select a block with an image and edit it with the pencil icon, you’re actually editing the PROPERTIES of that image. Think about emails you receive and the images are previewed as little red x’s … or when you hover your mouse over an image you get some little pop up caption text. That’s part of the properties called alternate text. That’s the kind of editing you can do with the pencil icon on an image block. If you want to change the image itself, that’s different and done through the menu in the upper left sidebar and we’ll cover that later.

LINKS:
In addition to editing and customizing the template, you’ll want to add some hyperlinks to your email campaign. One of the biggest business benefits of Act! emarketing is the business intelligence it generates for ou based on how people interact with the email campaigns you send. If you have multiple links in the email, the call list that is generated will clearly show not only who is interested in the information you sent, but what information in particular, making your follow up calls easier to plan and target. For example, Nicky’s email campaign might include links to breakfast, lunch and dinner menus as well as catering. Based on the number of click-thru’s on each link, she can begin to gauge which day part is generating the most interest.

Let’s take a look at how we add links to the email campaign. Hover your mouse over the text block you want to edit with a hyperlink. Position the cursor in the text and select the HYPERLINK icon that looks like a globe with a chain link in front of it. Enter the web address you want to link to and the text you want to show in the email. You an even check to be sure the link works.

Like most small business owners, Nicky doesn’t have a big budget for marketing. So, she was really excited to find out that Act emarketing comes with dozens of professional quality templates that can be customized to fit any business. They’re also organized by category based on the type of business and Nicky is pretty excited to see there’s a category with lots of samples that will work for her. Let’s pick a yummy looking template and start customizing it for Nicky.

My Templates:
Templates you create will be store here. On your first visit to Act! emarketing this area will be blank.

My Imported Templates:
Act! emarketing allows you to import templates in an html format.

Stock Templates.
This is the holding area for the dozens of professional quality stock templates available with Act! emarketing. They are organized by category to help you find templates that you can easily customize to fit your business needs.

When working with templates in Act emarketing, it’s important to remember that everything is organized into BLOCKS. Text is organized in blocks. Images appear in blocks. When we want to customize the template, we’ll do it by editing the BLOCK.

Like most small business owners, Nicky doesn’t have a big budget for marketing. So, she was really excited to find out that Act emarketing comes with dozens of professional quality templates that can be customized to fit any business. They’re also organized by category based on the type of business and Nicky is pretty excited to see there’s a category with lots of samples that will work for her. Let’s pick a yummy looking template and start customizing it for Nicky.

Stock Templates.
This is the holding area for the dozens of professional quality stock templates available with Act! emarketing. They are organized by category to help you find templates that you can easily customize to fit your business needs.

Watch as I hover my mouse over a block.

Notice a little “mini menu bar” appears.

That’s how we can edit the block that we selected.

Click on each of the 4 icons on the mini menu bar to find out what each can do to help Nicky customize her template.

The PENCIL ICON lets you edit the contents of the block and that means different things based on whether you’re editing a block of text, a block with a picture in it, or hyperlinks. Let’s start by looking at how to edit a block of TEXT.

TEXT:
To edit the text in a block, hover your mouse over the block and click on the Pencil icon to edit it. A text editing box will appear and you can replace the placeholder text with your own text. You can even format the text for color, font, size etc. Remember, you must "Commit Changes" or Save the block in order for your custom text to "stick" - always click the "Commit Changes" or Save icon (floppy disk) in the upper right of the block when you've finished your edits.

IMAGES:
Now let’s look at what the pencil icon does when editing a block with a picture in it. When you select a block with an image and edit it with the pencil icon, you’re actually editing the PROPERTIES of that image. Think about emails you receive and the images are previewed as little red x’s … or when you hover your mouse over an image you get some little pop up caption text. That’s part of the properties called alternate text. That’s the kind of editing you can do with the pencil icon on an image block. If you want to change the image itself, that’s different and done through the menu in the upper left sidebar and we’ll cover that later.

In addition to editing and customizing the template, you’ll want to add some hyperlinks to your email campaign. One of the biggest business benefits of Act! emarketing is the business intelligence it generates for ou based on how people interact with the email campaigns you send. If you have multiple links in the email, the call list that is generated will clearly show not only who is interested in the information you sent, but what information in particular, making your follow up calls easier to plan and target. For example, Nicky’s email campaign might include links to breakfast, lunch and dinner menus as well as catering. Based on the number of click-thru’s on each link, she can begin to gauge which day part is generating the most interest.

Let’s take a look at how we add links to the email campaign. Hover your mouse over the text block you want to edit with a hyperlink. Enter the web address you want to link to and the text you want to show in the email. You an even check to be sure the link works.

The PENCIL ICON lets you edit the contents of the block and that means different things based on whether you’re editing a block of text, a block with a picture in it, or hyperlinks. Let’s start by looking at how to edit a block of TEXT.

TEXT:
To edit the text in a block, hover your mouse over the block and click on the Pencil icon to edit it. A text editing box will appear and you can replace the placeholder text with your own text. You can even format the text for color, font, size etc. Remember, you must "Commit Changes" or Save the block in order for your custom text to "stick" - always click the "Commit Changes" or Save icon (floppy disk) in the upper right of the block when you've finished your edits.

IMAGES:
Now let’s look at what the pencil icon does when editing a block with a picture in it. When you select a block with an image and edit it with the pencil icon, you’re actually editing the PROPERTIES of that image. Think about emails you receive and the images are previewed as little red x’s … or when you hover your mouse over an image you get some little pop up caption text. That’s part of the properties called alternate text. That’s the kind of editing you can do with the pencil icon on an image block. If you want to change the image itself, that’s different and done through the menu in the upper left sidebar and we’ll cover that later.

LINKS:
In addition to editing and customizing the template, you’ll want to add some hyperlinks to your email campaign. One of the biggest business benefits of Act! emarketing is the business intelligence it generates for ou based on how people interact with the email campaigns you send. If you have multiple links in the email, the call list that is generated will clearly show not only who is interested in the information you sent, but what information in particular, making your follow up calls easier to plan and target. For example, Nicky’s email campaign might include links to breakfast, lunch and dinner menus as well as catering. Based on the number of click-thru’s on each link, she can begin to gauge which day part is generating the most interest.

Let’s take a look at how we add links to the email campaign. Hover your mouse over the text block you want to edit with a hyperlink. Position the cursor in the text and select the HYPERLINK icon that looks like a globe with a chain link in front of it. Enter the web address you want to link to and the text you want to show in the email. You an even check to be sure the link works.

The PENCIL ICON lets you edit the contents of the block and that means different things based on whether you’re editing a block of text, a block with a picture in it, or hyperlinks. Let’s start by looking at how to edit a block of TEXT.

TEXT:
To edit the text in a block, hover your mouse over the block and click on the Pencil icon to edit it. A text editing box will appear and you can replace the placeholder text with your own text. You can even format the text for color, font, size etc. Remember, you must "Commit Changes" or Save the block in order for your custom text to "stick" - always click the "Commit Changes" or Save icon (floppy disk) in the upper right of the block when you've finished your edits.

IMAGES:
Now let’s look at what the pencil icon does when editing a block with a picture in it. When you are creating or editing an email template, you will be editing image properties. Select a block with an image and edit it with the pencil icon, you’re actually editing the PROPERTIES of that image. Think about emails you receive and the images are previewed as little red x’s … or when you hover your mouse over an image you get some little pop up caption text. That’s part of the properties called alternate text. That’s the kind of editing you can do with the pencil icon on an image block. If you want to change the image itself, that’s different and done through the menu in the Upper Left menu bar and we’ll cover that later in this course. Also, Advanced editing of an image (such as rotating and adding text is covered in Advanced Image Editing.

LINKS:
In addition to editing and customizing the template, you’ll want to add some hyperlinks to your email campaign. One of the biggest business benefits of Act! emarketing is the business intelligence it generates for ou based on how people interact with the email campaigns you send. If you have multiple links in the email, the call list that is generated will clearly show not only who is interested in the information you sent, but what information in particular, making your follow up calls easier to plan and target. For example, Nicky’s email campaign might include links to breakfast, lunch and dinner menus as well as catering. Based on the number of click-thru’s on each link, she can begin to gauge which day part is generating the most interest.

Let’s take a look at how we add links to the email campaign. Hover your mouse over the text block you want to edit with a hyperlink. Position the cursor in the text and select the HYPERLINK icon that looks like a globe with a chain link in front of it. Enter the web address you want to link to and the text you want to show in the email. You an even check to be sure the link works.

The Plus sign icon allows you to "grab a block" in order to move it to another location in the template.

Hover your mouse over the block you want to move. Click and HOLD on the Plus sign icon and drag the block to the desired location.
After creating your email campaign, you need to determine who you will be sending it to.

After creating your email campaign, you need to determine who you will be sending it to.

To do that we need to go to the Manage Groups option in Act! emarketing. Nicky already has a wealth of contact information in Act! from her years in business.

Act! emarketing leverages those and when we click on Manage Your Groups we’re taken directly into the groups in Act! If we needed to update or create new groups we could do that by selecting the Manage your Groups option in Act! emarketing.

But, if you’re like Nicky and your groups are already up-to-date and organized for your marketing efforts, you’re already ready to move to the next step!

After creating your email campaign, you need to determine who you will be sending it to.

To do that we need to go to the Manage Groups option in Act! emarketing. Nicky already has a wealth of contact information in Act! from her years in business.

Act! emarketing leverages those and when we click on Manage Your Groups we’re taken directly into the groups in Act! If we needed to update or create new groups we could do that by selecting the Manage your Groups option in Act! emarketing.

But, if you’re like Nicky and your groups are already up-to-date and organized for your marketing efforts, you’re already ready to move to the next step!

Nicky’s getting pretty excited! She’s ready to send the email!

To do that we go to the SEND EMAIL option in Act! emarketing.

After creating your email campaign, you need to determine who you will be sending it to.

To do that we need to go to the Manage Groups option in Act! emarketing. Nicky already has a wealth of contact information in Act! from her years in business.

Act! emarketing leverages those and when we click on Manage Your Groups we’re taken directly into the groups in Act! If we needed to update or create new groups we could do that by selecting the Manage your Groups option in Act! emarketing.

But, if you’re like Nicky and your groups are already up-to-date and organized for your marketing efforts, you’re already ready to move to the next step!

Nicky has a lot of options here. She want to send it to a group of existing catering customers she has that she’s already identified as being within 15 miles of the café. So she’ll slect the GROUP radio button and then use the drop down to pick that group. To find out how many contacts are in that group with an email address, she could click on the Count button.
The subject line takes some thought because Nicky doesn’t want her email to get filtered as junk or spam so she’s always careful to give it some thought. She chooses a meaningful announcement that she hopes will catch her customer’s attention.
Next she needs to select the template to send… Right now there’s only one to choose from so that’s easy. If she had more but didn’t see the one she wanted, she’d just click REFRESH template list to update it with the most recent information.
Nicky can even decide when she sends her emails. She could send it right away or set a particular date and time to schedule it for sending.
Finally, Nicky needs to certify that she understands and abides by the Anti-Spam policy… Nicky knows that nobody likes SPAM… she doesn’t want to be responsible for sending it and she certainly won’t be serviing in her café either!

Now the big moment has arrived. She’s ready to send it. Click OK to send it off!
Check it out! Nicky even get an email from Act! emarketing confirming the email was sent! And that’s just the beginning of the intelligence of Act! emarketing.

Nicky heads back into Act! emarketing and remember the start up screen we went through earlier? We’ll here those bottom two panels are now filled with information! Act emarketing has generated a call list based on the campaign she sent and how recipients have responded to it. On the right hand side she can see who opened it, which links they clicked and how many times! Looks like quite a few people are pretty excited about her grand opening for the café and she can make some calls to keep the interest level high and generate a big crowd for opening day.

In addition to generating a call list for Nicky, Act! emarketing creates even more powerful business intelligence through campaign reports. Let’s take a look at those.
Act! emarketing tracks how recipients interact with her email campaign over time and creates a number of great reports to help her stay informed and plan her next steps.
To view the available reports, select Campaign Reports.

The dashboard for campaign reports shows a summary of every campaign that has been sent and lots more detail is available by selecting a report to view.

Let’s look at the one for Nicky’s first email.


This is the summary view. It shows a thumbnail of every campaign that has been sent with a banner indicating the open rate. Click on a campaign to view the report for that particular campaign.

From here Nicky can see how many emails were opened, and how many links in her campaign were clicked on by recipients. This is really great information for Nicky to have to keep a finger on the pulse of what’s working and what’s not in her emarketing efforts.
Hey look down at the bottom right… Nicky can share email campaign on social networks. That was also available to her back when she was creating and editing her template but she wasn’t sure she wanted to put it out there on social media since it was her first try at emarketing… but now that she knows it’s being well-received and generating some interest, she may just decide to click in here and share it on her business social media sites as well.
There’s even more detail available for Nicky. See the eyeball icon? Click on that to dive deeper.
This view has great details about who clicked on which link and how many times. This will really help Nicky make targeted follow-up efforts with her customers based on their interest.

In the lower left there’s a graph showing clicks by link. That will show Nicky the overall results for each of the links in her email campaign. And note the eyeball icon again… there’s more detail available by clicking on that.

From here Nicky can see how many emails were opened, and how many links in her campaign were clicked on by recipients. This is really great information for Nicky to have to keep a finger on the pulse of what’s working and what’s not in her emarketing efforts.
Hey look down at the bottom right… Nicky can share email campaign on social networks. That was also available to her back when she was creating and editing her template but she wasn’t sure she wanted to put it out there on social media since it was her first try at emarketing… but now that she knows it’s being well-received and generating some interest, she may just decide to click in here and share it on her business social media sites as well.

There are even more option to customize the email campaign in the upper left. These options deal with the overall template itself - things like background color, template elements like text fields and coupons and the images available for use. Click on each of the three options in the upper left menu to learn more.


Customize Elements
This menu allows you to format elements of the template such as the background color or block borders. It works through drag and drop. Simply click and HOLD on the color or design feature you want to apply to the template, and drag it to the block you want to apply to.

Add Elements
This menu holds some common marketing elements you may want to add to your template like coupons and text fields. Simply click and HOLD on the element you want to add and drag it tot he block of the template where you want it to appear. Then, if necessary, edit the new element using the Pencil icon in the mini-menu bar.

Images
This is the holding area for all the stock images available in Act! emarketing. They are categorized for ease of searching. To replace an existing image in a template with an image from the stock image gallery simply click on HOLD on the new image and drag it to the template block you want to insert it in and release.

Advanced options for editing the size and other properties of an image are available through the MEDIA menu in the Act! emarketing menu in the upper right.

Great! Nicky’s first email campaign is starting to come together. But before she saves it and sends it, it’s always a good idea to preview it. Let’s do that now. To Preview it, click on the EYEBALL icon in the upper right.

You can preview how the email will look on different devices, see how it would look if the images were disabled initially and see that alternative text we discussed earlier, and one of the best things we can do is send the email to our own email address to preview it as a quality check. For example, Nicky could send this email to herself to see how it looks .

Great! Nicky’s first email campaign is starting to come together. But before she saves it and sends it, it’s always a good idea to preview it. Let’s do that now. To Preview it, click on the EYEBALL icon in the upper right.

You can preview how the email will look on different devices, see how it would look if the images were disabled initially and see that alternative text we discussed earlier, and one of the best things we can do is send the email to our own email address to preview it as a quality check. For example, Nicky could send this email to herself to see how it looks .

Nicky’s ready to save the email! To save the entire template, we click on the SUBMIT icon in the far upper right. When we click on that, we need to name the Template and specify where to save it. And since this is the first template Nicky’s created, we need to create a folder for it in the My Templates area. That will keep it separate from the stock templates in Act! emarketing. I’ll enter Grand Opening for this one and if she does any additional campaigns for the grand opening, she can see them here or she could create a new folder.

Advanced image editing such as CROP, ROTATE, RESIZE, ADD TEXT and more, is available in Act! emarketing through the MEDIA menu option.

Select the MEDIA menu option from the upper right.

Select the image you want to edit - either by uploading it or selecting an existing image in the Images Gallery.

Hover your mouse of the selected image and select COPY.

NOTE: You'll want to make a copy of image and edit it for your customization. That way, the original image will still be available for use as well.

After saving the copy of the image to your folder, access it and hover your mouse over it. Select the PENCIL ICON to edit it.

The image will appear with an advanced editing toolbar.

Select the advanced editing feature you'd like to apply.
